result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Sanfelippo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample, if not done already. Pay court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-16; failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.

Concurrent with: EACH OTHER AS TO BOTH COUNTS; and consecutive to any other sentence (incarceration may be served in WSP)

- Court does not object to participation in the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of GUILTY PLEA / SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing OCTOBER 14, 2015, received and filed. (28 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  INSTITUTION

Decision and Order Denying Request For Concurrent Sentence received and filed. tk 
Copies mailed to Parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for concurrent sentence.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and defense.

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 3 MONTHS HOC (incarceration may be served in WSP) concurrent with Count 2 in case 15CF644 and consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 0 days time served.

- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

AS TO COUNT 2 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 3 MONTHS HOC (incarceration may be served in WSP) concurrent with Count 2 in case 15CF644 and consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 0 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2 -
- The Court does not object to participation in the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12/31/16; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample, if not done already.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Michael A Sanfelippo in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Michael A Sanfelippo in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Michael A Sanfelippo not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Any motions due no later than 10-14-2015 at 8:30. Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing on 10-14-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 17. Jury Trial scheduled for 12-07-215 at 9:00 am, branch 17. 


Case is adjourned for Projected plea and sentencing hearing on 10-14-2015 at 8:30, and Jury Trial scheduled on 12-07-2015 at 9:00 am, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Request for Prompt Dispostion, received on 09-10-2015, initial appearance was set on 09-21-2015. Deadline is on 01-06-2016.  tk

Original Information filed.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.   The state turns over discovery materials to defense.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Angela C.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.

Defendant Michael A Sanfelippo in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Michael A Sanfelippo in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Not guilty plea entered as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
